meanings.sent1: The criminal was taken to the carcel for his crime.
meanings.sent2: The carcel was heavily guarded to prevent any escapes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pencil go to the carcel? It led a life of crime!
meanings.sent4: His guilt was a heavy carcel, trapping him in his own remorse.
meanings.sent5: The carcel loomed in the distance, a symbol of justice and punishment.

meanings.definition: A unit of illumination equal to one candlepower.
meanings.sent1: The room was bright with the light of a single carcel.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the carcel to brighten the dark corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The carcel decided to take a break, tired of shining all day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a carcel, lighting up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The carcel flickered, casting shadows on the walls.
